model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Athlete: Ted Athlete unrolls the map. He looks at it for a few moments before tracing his finger along one of the highways. "This is our route," he says finally, feeling in control.

[MEMORY]
1. The Athlete is focused on helping the team succeed and has shown leadership qualities during warm-ups and stretches.
2. The Athlete is focused on improving their performance and energy levels.
3. The Athlete usually likes the flavor of the gum but is finding it distracting in this instance.
4. The Athlete seeks approval and praise from the Coach.
5. The Athlete has been taking on more responsibilities and has gained respect from other players.
6. The Coach encourages the Athlete to keep up the good work and acknowledges their achievements.

raw_prediction: That's great, Ted! Your attention to detail and leadership in planning our route is really impressive. It shows that you're not only focused on your own performance but also on the team's success. Keep up the good work!
